DzRenderData Class Reference

Class that contains the raw data of a single bucket from a rendering operation. The bucket data represented by this class is explicitly shared making it very efficient to pass instances of DzRenderData by value. However, since the sharing is explicit, changing one copy of the data changes all the copies. To detach a DzRenderData object from other copies of the same data, create() can be used. More...

#include <dzrenderdata.h>

Detailed Description

Class that contains the raw data of a single bucket from a rendering operation. The bucket data represented by this class is explicitly shared making it very efficient to pass instances of DzRenderData by value. However, since the sharing is explicit, changing one copy of the data changes all the copies. To detach a DzRenderData object from other copies of the same data, create() can be used.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzRenderData::DzRenderData (  ) 

Default Constructor. Creates an unitialized rendered bucket with no data.

int  y,
int  w,
int  h,
unsigned char *  imgData 
)

Creates, allocates storage, and initializes data for a rendered bucket.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate of the rendered bucket.
y The y coordinate of the rendered bucket.
w The width of the rendered bucket.
h The height of the rendered bucket.
imgData A pointer to the data for the rendered bucket. This is assumed to be 32-bit per pixel image data ordered as RGBA with one byte per channel.
DzRenderData::DzRenderData ( int  x,
int  y,
const QImage &  img 
)

Creates, allocates storage, and initializes data for a rendered bucket. This is less efficient and more resource intensive than specifying the raw data. It is highly recommended not to use this function when many small buckets will be generated. When only a few large buckets are generated, this function is acceptable.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate of the rendered bucket.
y The y coordinate of the rendered bucket.
img The data for the rendered bucket.
DzRenderData::DzRenderData ( const DzRenderData &  data  ) 

Copy constructor. The bucket data itself is explicitly shared making this function very efficient.

Member Function Documentation

bool DzRenderData::copyToImage ( QImage &  img,
int  xOffset = 0,
int  yOffset = 0 
) const

Copies the bucket into the target image. The x and y position of the render bucket will determine where the top left corner of the bucket will be in the target image.

Parameters:
img The image to copy the bucket into.
bool DzRenderData::create ( int  w,
int  h 
)

Creates a new data buffer for the bucket's data, discarding any existing bucket data.

Parameters:
w The width of the bucket data in pixels.
h The height of the bucket data in pixels.
Returns:
true if the data was created, false if an invalid size was specified.
unsigned char * DzRenderData::data (  ) 
Returns:
A pointer to the data for the render bucket. This data should be interpreted as 32-bit image data ordered as RGBA with one byte per channel / four bytes per pixel. The first pixel in the data is the top left image pixel, and data proceeds from one line at a time left-to-right, top-to-bottom.
const unsigned char * DzRenderData::data (  )  const
Returns:
A pointer to the data for the render bucket. This data should be interpreted as 32-bit image data ordered as RGBA with one byte per channel / four bytes per pixel. The first pixel in the data is the top left image pixel, and data proceeds from one line at a time left-to-right, top-to-bottom.
bool DzRenderData::drawToPainter ( QPainter &  painter,
int  xOffset = 0,
int  yOffset = 0,
bool  useAlpha = false 
) const

Draws the bucket with the given painter. The x and y position of the render bucket will detrmine where the top left corner of the bucket will be drawn.

Parameters:
painter The painter to draw the render bucket with.
useAlpha If true, the alpha channel in the render data (if any) will be passed to the painter. If false, the image will be drawn by the painter as fully opaque.

Assignment Operator. The bucket data itself is explicitly shared making this function very efficient.
